column4: hi.  I have 300meg of memory listed as used in system monitor, but system monitor also reports that i'm using 1.5 GIG of ram (not including cache).  What's going on?
the 300 megs of ram is what i calculated by adding all the memory listed for all the processes.
it's quite possible that you didn't add the memory of all threads of each process
possibly.  but i'm not running much of anything right now, certainly not 1.5g worth
linux uses a lot of space for disk caches and stuff; it's using your memory as efficiently as possible
doesn't look like it.  Cache is reported seperately.
looks like a huge memory leak to me
free -m will give you the most accurate data. if you pastebin the entire output of the command, I'll be able to tell you the truth. and as far as I know the memory leak was fixed
all three are memory hogs. they're browsers after all!
but they are closed now.  http://pastebin.com/Hp5yvLS8
don't forget that 1329 + 80 of the 2959 used are caches
right. do you see that i'm using 1.5gig not including caches?
and again, in system monitor, if i add up the memory listed by the processes listed, it's about 300meg.  which seems about right.
you are correct. i'd suggest running "watch free" and seeing how quickly the memory is increasing; report a bug if you think it's a memory leak
